choices: Ask her again what she was talking about
Wait for her to explain in a week
1.content:
"Smile!" Samantha says, pointing the camera at you and Felicity.

You and your best friend grin and the camera flash goes off.

"Did it work?" Felicity says to herself, looking around. "Yes. I think it worked."

"What are you talking about?" you ask her, confused.

"Oh hi Tamara." she greets you, which is odd because you've been here at her birthday party for the last 2 hours.

"What's wrong with you?" you ask her.

"Nothing." she says. "My invention worked."

"What invention?" you ask, getting more confused. "What are you talking about?"

"I'll tell you in a week." she says. "Anyway, enjoy the party.. and thanks for the earrings." with that she wanders off to the table where all of her presents are stacked up.

How does she know that you bought her earrings? She hasn't unwrapped her presents yet. As you ponder this question, she picks up the small box from the table and removes the wrapping paper, then opens the box, revealing the earrings. She takes them out and then stops on the spot, looking confused.
1.title: Smile

11.content:
You walk over to her side and say "Felicity?"

"huh?" she seems disoriented. "Oh, did you get me these?" she holds up the earrings.

"Yes." you say. "but..."

"They are beautiful." she says. "I love them. Thank you Tamara."

"What were you just talking about?" you ask.

"When?" she replies.

"Just then." you say. "Samantha took our photo. You said your invention worked."

"I did?" she asks.

"Yes." you say, getting a little annoyed. "What invention are you talking about?"

"Maybe it worked..." she says, mostly to herself. "What else did I say?"

"You said you'd explain in a week." you inform her.

"Wow." she says. "Only a week away. That's great."

"What's only a week away?" you ask.

"Finishing my invention." she says.

"What invention?" you demand, now sick of this game.

"Shh." she whispers. "It's a secret. I've been working on a time machine."

"Really?" you ask. "So that wan't you just then... or it was you but from the future?"

"Yeah." she says. "If my machine works it will let me jump my mind back in time to any point in my life where I was photographed."
11.title: Ask her again what she was talking about

choices: Ask her to let you test it.
111.content:
"Can I see it?" you ask.

"But it's not finished." she says.

"It will be in a week." you say. "Come on. I just want to see it."

"Fine." she says. "Stick around after the party and I'll show you."

When the other guests have left, you help clean up then she leads you into the spare bedroom which she uses as a lab.

In the centre of the room is a chair, covered with electrodes. A bundle of wires runs from the chair to a computer.

"This is your time machine?" you ask.

"Well." she says. "Not yet."

"What's wrong with it?" you ask.

"The targetting." she says.

"What do you mean?" you ask. "Who are you trying to shoot."

"No. You don't understand" she says. "I can create the mental wormhole to the moment a photo was taken but not the right person."

"You're right. I don't understand." you say. "You mean you could end up in someone else's body?"

"Yeah." she says, thinking for a moment. Then she adds with a smile "You could."

"What are you thinking?" you ask, a little concerned by her smile.

"I was only thinking of jumping back into myself." She says. "But then I can only go back as far as the day I was born. If I can target anyone I can go back as far as there have been photos. I could meet Einstein."

"You could be Einstein." you point out.

"Yeah." she says. "I've got to get to work."
111.title: Ask to see her machine

choices: Ask if that is what was happening at the party
12.content:
Felicity is a physicist and a little eccentric. You decide to just wait and see.

As promised, one week later Felicity calls you. "It's ready." she says. "Come over and see."

"What's ready?" you ask. "Your invention?"

"Yep." she says. "Come over. I want you to be here when I try it the first time."

Excited to finally find out what this is all about you rush over.

"So..." you say when Felicity greets you at her front door. "What is this secret invention of yours?"

"Come in." she says, letting you inside and locking the front door. "This way." She leads you into the room next to her bedroom which she uses as a lab.

In the centre of the room is a chair, covered with electrodes. A bundle of wires runs from the chair to a computer.

"What is it?" you ask.

"A time machine." she announces.

"What?" you ask. "You mean you can ride this chair through time?"

"Not quite." she explains. "According to my calculations, it's impossible to send something to a different time. Matter is locked to it's own timeline."

"So it's not a time machine?" you're getting confused.

"No it is." she says. "But it only sends your mind. You jump into your own body at some point in the past."
12.title: Wait for her to explain in a week

choices: Ask if this was all a joke
121.content:
"Wait..." you say, finally understanding. "So at your birthday party, when you were acting weird, that was actually you now?"

"A few seconds from now." she says. "I'm just about to do it."

She presses a few keys on the computer's keyboard and a picture appears on screen. It's the photo of you and her at her birthday party last week.

"You need a photo." she explains. "It works like a bookmark in your life."

"Um." you say, barely keeping up. "Okay."

"You also need an Anchor." she explains. "Something to bring you back to the present."

"What's that?" you ask.

"It can be any object." she says. "You have to be touching it when you make the jump. Then, when you touch it again in the past you jump back to the moment you left."

"The earrings?" you say, noticing that she's wearing them right now. "Yes." she says. "Good idea, they would have been at the party."

You consider trying to explain that it wasn't your idea and that you already saw her do it but it's all too complicated.

"Okay." she says, sitting in the chair. "Here I go."

She hits the "enter" key and nothing happens.

"Wow." she says. "It really worked."

"What worked?" you ask. "You didn't go anywhere."

"Yes I did." she says. "I went back to the party. Remember?"
121.title: Ask if that is what was happening at the party

1211.content:
"This has all been a joke." you say. "Hasn't it?"

"No." she says. "I really went back in time."

"You can cut the bullshit Felicity." you say, getting a little annoyed with her. "I don't know why you'd go to so much effort for such a weak joke."

"You don't believe me?" she asks, acting a little hurt.

"You're really going to keep up the act?" you ask.

"It's not an act." she insists. "I really did build a time machine."

"Whatever." you reply.

"Okay then." she says, typing on the keyboard. "If you don't believe me, you won't have any problem sitting in the chair." As she says this another photo appears on the screen. It's an old photo of the two of you sitting in the bath together when you were about 1 year old.

Calling her bluff you sit down "Fine. Go ahead."

"Alright. You asked for it." She takes an old teddy bear from a nearby shelf. "You might want to hold on to this. you know, just in case." she throws it to you. "I owned if back there. Remember you'll have to touch it to come home."

She goes back to the keyboard. "Here we go."
1211.title: Ask if this was all a joke

choices: Go see if Felicity's teddy bear is here
12111.content:
You are suddenly nervous and grip the teddy bear tightly. You worry that she just might be telling the truth.

Felicity hits the enter key and suddenly you are sitting naked in a half-filled bathtub. Giggling next to you is 1 year-old Felicity.

Looking down at you from behind a camera is your mother, although much younger than the last time you saw her. "I'm saving that photo for your 21st" she says, putting the camera aside.

"Oh ma ga." You half form your words. "See wa tellin da tooth."

"Okay." you think to your self. "I need to find that teddy bear."

"I think you girls have been in there long enough." your mother decides, bending down to lift you out of the tub. She places you on the fluffy bathmat. She wraps a towel around you then returns for Felicity.

With you both dried off, your mother carries both of you out of the bathroom and into a nursery, this must have been your room when you were a baby.

She places you both on the floor and goes to retrieve some items from under the changing table.

Felicity crawls around happily, apparently unaware of the fact she should be embarrassed by her nakedness.

"Okay." your mother says, picking up Felicity. "You first." she places her up on the changing table and gets to work diapering her.
12111.title: Hold onto the teddy bear

choices: Tell her that it did work
Just watch and wait for her to touch the earrings
1212.content:
"Can I have a go?" you ask, still not sure you believe her.

"Um." she says. "Okay. We need a photo of you."

"I was in the photo you used." you remind her.

"Oh yeah." she says. "Um. You need and anchor."

"Something that was at your party" you suggest. "I want to make sure I can get back."

"You'd only have to wait a week if you can't." she points out. "But you're right."

She leads you out to the living room and the two of you look around for something convenient.

"How about the TV remote." you suggest, picking it up from the coffee table.

"That'll do." she says. "Okay, let's go."

She leads you back to the lab. "Sit down." she's already typing on the keyboard. "And make sure you're holding the Anchor."

You sit on the chair, clutching the remote tightly. The photo appears on the monitor and she asks. "Ready?"

"Um." you say. "Yeah. I guess."

"Here we go." she hits the enter key.

Suddenly you are back at the party, standing with your arm around Felicity.

"Did it work?" Felicity says, just like last time. "Yes. I think it worked."
1212.title: Ask to try it yourself

info.brief_description: A machine lets you jump back to the moment any photograph of you was taken
info.description:
If you like reading or writing interactive stories with AB/DL themes please join our Google Group:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/thicklypadded

You are Tamara, a 25 year-old woman. Felicity, your best friend, is a physicist. In her spare time she has been working on an invention and wants you to be the first to try it out.

Her invention is a time machine... well sort of. It will send you back in time, but only your mind.

You need a photograph of the moment you want to jump back to. The device scans the photo and transfers your mind back into your body at that point in time.

In order to jump back you need an anchor. This is any object you are touching at the moment your mind was transferred. When you touch the same object in the past, your mind will return to the present at the exact moment you left.
